standing in a crowd of PAX east kids at South Station and talked with a few. (was in Boston for a concert.) Lots of complaints about indie games being "essentially unfinished," "too expensive ($10!)" etc. The vast majority really have no idea how hard this stuff is to do, do they

Cataloguing Roger Reynolds' library and I stumble on crazy rare stuff like this: a privately published art novella by Takemitsu, called "Arui wa a Honey Moon."  Of course it's a pun: Japanese "hone" means "bone" in English. TIL Takemitsu was also a horror fantasy author (!).pic.twitter.com/WcI4wjxwyL

for my next project all UI conventions will be inverted.  Grays will be used for things activated/available, and bright colors will be inactive/unavailable.  It'll be such a pleasure to use

Friday night #procgen save point music. No melody this time, but the machine is fully responsible for smooth voice-leading, which greatly increases flexibility. Lots in Javascript now. wrote a script for finding the most isolated rare item spawn locations by average distance to neighbors, then pruned that list hierarchically, removing neighbors.  Didn't use a k-d tree - we really don't have that many locations.pic.twitter.com/KouK39aYsJ
